prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you enjoy participating in, and what topics do you typically discuss or read about in these spaces?
I like low carb and keto groups where we talk about healthy eating.
What other topics outside of health and nutrition do you find yourself reading or researching about online?
Art is my first love, my true passion.
Can you share more about the types of art you are passionate about and if there are any other hobbies or interests you pursue in your free time?
I like Van Gogh and Chuck Close paintings because I am an oil painter.

What other genres or mediums of art do you appreciate, and are there any specific online platforms or resources you frequently visit to learn more about art or to get inspiration for your own oil paintings?
I watch modern technique videos on YouTube, where artists use unusual materials.
What other interests or hobbies do you have outside of art and healthy eating, and how do you typically engage with these interests online?
I really love blockchain technologies and cryptocurrencies.

Can you tell me more about your interest in blockchain technologies and cryptocurrencies, such as how you stay updated on this topic, any online communities you're part of, or how you apply this interest in your daily life?
I watch crypto experts online and read market news.
Do you have any favorite authors or genres in literature, and how do you usually consume this content - through physical books, e-books, audiobooks, or online articles?
I listen to non-fiction marketing audio books because I don't have time to read physical books.
What other topics related to technology or business do you find intriguing, and how do you engage with these topics online - through podcasts, webinars, online courses, or forums?
I am interested in disruptive technologies.

Can you elaborate on your interest in disruptive technologies, such as specific areas you're drawn to, how you stay informed about the latest developments, and if there are any online communities or resources you rely on for this information?
I like tech that does old things in a newly improved way, like VR and foldable phones.
What other innovative or emerging technologies have caught your attention recently, and how do you typically explore and learn about these new technologies online?
I also read a lot about NFTs.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
